items.stem: What is the purpose of a disinfectant?
options: To remove visible dirt and grease only
To reduce harmful microbes to a safe level
To make surfaces smell fresh
To rinse off detergent
items.rationale: Disinfectants reduce microbes to a safe level after cleaning.

items.stem: Which sequence describes a two-stage clean?
options: Apply disinfectant then dry with cloth
Rinse with water then disinfectant then dry
Detergent clean and rinse, then disinfect and leave for full contact time
Spray air freshener then wipe
items.rationale: Stage one is clean and rinse; stage two is disinfect for the full contact time.

options: How long staff spend cleaning per day
How long the surface stays wet with disinfectant
The time before food can touch the surface again
The age of the chemical since opening
items.rationale: Contact time is how long the disinfectant must remain wet to work.

options: On the top shelf above food prep
In any cupboard if bottles are closed
In a designated area away from food with controls in place
Next to ingredients for speed
items.rationale: Chemicals are kept away from food in a controlled, labelled area.

options: Leave lids open to reduce smells
Empty only when overflowing
Use liners and close lids, clean and disinfect bins daily
Store waste next to ready-to-eat food
items.rationale: Keep bins lined, closed, and cleaned to control pests.
